data.title: Jessamine County KentuckyHome
data.text:
Low-interest disaster loans

Did you know the U.S. Small Business Administration provides low-interest disaster loans to businesses of all sizes, private non-profit organizations, homeowners, and renters? Learn more at SBA.gov/Disaster. Brought to you by the Office of Disaster Recovery and Resilience. More information: English Version Flyer, Spanish Version Flyer.

SPACE

PreSchool & Kindergarten Registration for 2024-2025

Preschool Application Packets & Kindergarten Registration Packets for the 2024-2025 School Year are now available. These are located outside the main entrance at Jessamine Early Learning Village (JELV), 851 Wilmore Road in Nicholasville. Please pick up a packet any time that is convenient to you, then drop off your completed packet any school day between the hours of 9:00 AM – 1:00 PM. Only COMPLETE packets will be accepted. During the summer, packets will be accepted Monday-Thursday from 9:00 AM – 12:00 PM. Families of currently enrolled preschool students do not need to complete a registration packet. Your student’s preschool teacher will be sending home registration information soon.

Building Rental Reservations

Jessamine County Fiscal Court takes reservations for County Buildings. Buildings available include the Blue Building at City County Park, High Bridge Pavilion in Wilmore, and the Keene Community Center located in Keene. You MUST apply in person and have the required $200.00 security deposit (check only) at initial January visit. To rent our facilities, you MUST be a Jessamine County Resident 21 years of age or older. For more information or any questions please feel free to contact the County Judge’s Office at (859)885-4500. More.

SPACE

Your New Career with Jessamine County

Explore the employment possibilities for your new career with Jessamine County Fiscal Court. See Current Listings and Application and list of Benefits! Opportunities can also be found posted on our Jessamine County Facebook Page. Jessamine County Fiscal Court is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug Free Workplace.

SPACE

Where do my Property Taxes Go?

Your annual Property Taxes are an important source of income for Jessamine County Fiscal Court and are used to fund services such as education, emergency, roads, parks, recreation, health and library. This 2023 Property Tax Chart shows the breakdown of how funds are distributed throughout the county.

SPACE

Metropolitan Transportation Plan 2050

The Metropolitan Planning Organization is looking ahead to 2050 and needs your input to guide future improvements to transportation in the area. The MTP is informed by traffic and safety data, changes in employment and population, and input from residents and local officials. Help update the long-term Metropolitan Transportation Plan by taking this survey. The survey takes about 5-10 minutes to complete. Thanks for taking the time!

SPACE

Large Animal Composting & Livestock Removal

Effective September 1, 2020, Large Animal Composting of KY (LACKY) in Casey County will handle removal of dead livestock in Jessamine County. This is a free service to ensure proper disposal of dead animals to protect water quality and community health. Owner Brent Woodrum asks livestock owners/producers to call or text as soon as the animal goes down day or night. Includes horses, cattle, sheep, hogs, goats, and other agricultural animals. Phone (859) 397-1078. More information.

Kentucky Transportation Projects in Jessamine County

Visit the Kentucky Transportation Cabinet website to see the local Jessamine County Projects. You can view the plans and get updates on roads and transportation projects in District 7.
